p: Anyone can be affected emotionally during an outbreak like COVID-19. Everyone reacts differently to critical scenarios. Fear, worry, and anxiety regarding COVID-19 can cause strong emotions such as stress and depression in a person. For example, a 62-year old patient under investigation for COVID-19, committed suicide in Serdang Hospital, Selangor, apparently due to depression [ 47, 48]. The MOH has published well-described guidelines on “Mental Health and Psychosocial Support in COVID-19 [ 21].” They included the mental health and psychosocial support services for individuals under COVID-19 investigation and those health care workers/response workers involved.
